verses.verse: ((1 This Psalm teacheth that the faithful ought only to look for help at God,7 who only doth maintain, preserve and prosper his Church.) ) I will lift up mine eyes unto the mountains, from whence my help shall come.
Mine help cometh from the Lord, which hath made the (He accuseth man’s ingratitude, which cannot depend on God’s power.) heaven and the earth.
He will not suffer thy foot to slip: for he that keepeth thee, will not (He showeth that God’s providence not only watcheth over his Church in general: but also over every member thereof.) slumber.
Behold, he that keepeth Israel, will neither slumber nor sleep.
The Lord is thy keeper: the Lord is thy shadow at thy right hand.
The sun shall not (Neither heat nor cold, nor any incommodity shall be able to destroy God’s Church, albeit for a time they may molest it.) smite thee by day, nor the moon by night.
The Lord shall preserve thee from all evil: he shall keep thy soul.
The Lord shall preserve thy (Whatsoever thou dost enterprise, shall have good success.) going out, and thy coming in from henceforth and forever.
